page.title: 18CUSTOMS-A LOCAL LEGEND
page.content: The{Cow and Calf}Rocks on{Ilkley {Moor}(O.S.Sheet 104 G.F.128,460)are a very famous tourist and recreational attraction.They are also the subjet of{local legend. The{Cow and Calf}Rocks and the {Skirtful of Stones}are associated with the legends of{Giant Rombald. As the giant was striding across the {Wharfe Valley}from{Almscliff Crag, seven miles away he cought his foot on the{Cow Rock}and broke of the {Calf}.{Giant Rombald's Wife}, as she hurried across the moor, dropped a pile of stones from her apron and these became known as the{Skirtful Of {Stones.
